task.title: Checking Hot Oil Level
task.shortdesc: A hot oil level check is made to determine if there is sufficient oil for working operation of the transmission.

p.note: Observe the condition of the oil in the visual level indicator or the type of flow from the plug opening. Foaming or spurting may indicate a false level.

step.cmd: Select neutral on the transmission range selector and start the engine.
Operate the vehicle until the transmission reaches a normal operating temperature of 82 - 103° C (180 - 220° F).
Idle the engine, apply the parking brake and block all road wheels.
Check the visual level indicator or remove the FULL (upper) oil level check plug.
The oil should be within the indicator limits or at or near the level of the plug opening.
Add or drain oil as necessary to bring the oil level within these limits.

result.note: The transmission may be operated safely as long as the oil level is above the ADD (lower) plug.
